ground_truth: They stare at him, followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries, which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again, pulling off his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a two-lane highway, bordered by snowfields, carrying one moving car, which is driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises and, as he leaves, the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits, staring at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, having sex with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away, and calls before someone takes the phone. Jerry wanders through the service area, where cars are being worked on, and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out front and smokes, gazing out the window. He is driving and on the phone. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone, which pops out of her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty, and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jerry enters the kitchen wearing a parka and red plaid hat, placing groceries on the counter. Wade Gustafson, in his sixties with gray hair, is present. An aerial view shows Carl Showalter driving on a snowy highway. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look. Jerry, in his sales cubicle, faces an irate couple, then leaves as they watch. Carl and Grimsrud are in twin beds with truck-stop hookers. A woman calls on the phone before someone else takes it. Jerry stops by an Indian inspecting a car. Carl drives while Grimsrud smokes. A morning-show host stands in a kitchen set. Jean rises as two men enter, and a door slams. Jean, sobbing, drops the phone, which smashes against the door. She opens a high window, stepping up from the toilet. The door knob falls, and Grimsrud and Carl enter the empty room with an open window. Carl exits through the window. Grimsrud searches the medicine cabinet, notices the drawn shower curtain, and reaches for it. The curtain bursts open as Jean, tangled, screams and stumbles into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: They fix their gaze intently upon him, followed by an awkward pause, as Jerry makes his entrance through the kitchen door. He is clad in a warm parka and a distinctive red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, and he carries a bag filled with groceries, which he promptly places on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters once more, this time removing his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, who is in his mid-sixties, appears vigorous and full of life, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial view of a two-lane highway, bordered by expansive snowfields, with a single moving car driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud casts a sour look at Carl, followed by a prolonged pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at him. Jerry finds himself seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, which is situated just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises from his seat, and as he departs, the couple watches him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits down again, staring at his lap in contemplation. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, engaging in intimate activities with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away from her ear, and calls out before someone else takes the phone from her. Jerry meanders through the service area, where various cars are being worked on, and he stops by an Indian man dressed in blue jeans, who is examining the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out the front window, smoking and gazing at the passing scenery. He continues to drive while talking on the phone. A morning-show host, wearing an apron, stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut with a loud bang. Jean, sobbing uncontrollably, frantically pushes at the buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free from the wall. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back nervously as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door comes to an end as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open with a creak, moving as one piece within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is empty, and the window stands open. Carl strides purposefully to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, searching for the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it suddenly explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Their eyes become fixated on him with an intense gaze, which is followed by an awkward silence, as Jerry strides confidently through the entrance of the kitchen door. He is dressed warmly in a cozy parka and topped with a distinctive red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, holding a bag brimming with groceries, which he immediately places on the kitchen counter with a casual familiarity. Jerry makes another entrance, this time taking off his plaid cap, and Wade Gustafson, a man in his mid-sixties, who exudes vitality and vigor, with a full head of gray hair, stands nearby. A twisting aerial perspective dramatically reveals a sprawling two-lane highway, bordered on either side by vast, expansive snowfields, with a solitary car being driven by Carl Showalter venturing along its path. Grimsrud directs a sour look towards Carl, succeeded by a lengthy pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly, almost vacantly, at him. Jerry finds himself seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, strategically positioned just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. Rising from his seat, Jerry departs, and the couple observes him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. He settles back into his chair, staring contemplatively at his lap, lost in thought. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud find themselves in twin beds, engaged in intimate activities with two truck-stop hookers. Elsewhere, a woman picks up the phone, holds it away from her ear to call out to someone, and then hands the phone over to another person. Jerry meanders through the active service area, where a variety of cars are being worked on, and stops by an Indian man, who is dressed in blue jeans, and is examining the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light hanging precariously off it. Carl is at the wheel, driving, while Grimsrud stares pensively out the front window, smoking and taking in the passing scenery. He continues to drive while engaging in a conversation on the phone. A cheerful morning-show host, adorned in an apron, stands behind a counter on a well-designed kitchen set. Jean carefully sets down her coffee cup and rises to her feet, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut with a loud, echoing bang. Jean, now sobbing uncontrollably, frantically jabs at the buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her grasp, clatters noisily across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free from the wall in a sudden snap. Jean crosses over to a high window above the toilet, throwing it open and glancing back nervously as she steps cautiously up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door gradually comes to an end as the wood surrounding its knob splinters apart, causing the knob itself to tumble onto the floor. The door swings open with a loud creak, moving as one cohesive piece within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is conspicuously empty, and the window is wide open. Carl strides purposefully to the window and hoists himself out with determination. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet with careful precision, delicately tapping aside various bottles and tubes as he searches for the appropriate unguent. He locates a salve but sets it down after noticing something reflected in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it suddenly bursts outward with a violent motion, animated by thrashing limbs, and Jean screams, tangled messily in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling clumsily out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They fix their gaze on him, creating a moment of awkward silence as Jerry steps through the kitchen door, clad in a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, while carrying a bag of groceries. He moves with purpose to the kitchen counter, where he places the bag down. Jerry re-enters the scene, this time removing his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, a man in his mid-sixties with a vigorous demeanor and a full head of gray hair, is present. The perspective shifts dramatically to reveal an aerial view of a two-lane highway, flanked by expansive snowfields, with a single car in motion, driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud casts a sour look at Carl, followed by a prolonged pause as Gaear Grimsrud fixes a blank stare on Carl. Jerry is seated in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle, positioned just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife. He stands up and, as he exits, the couple's eyes follow him as he moves into a nearby cubicle. Jerry then sits down, directing his gaze towards his lap. Meanwhile, Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, engaged in sexual activity with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, holds it at a distance, and calls out before someone else takes the phone from her. Jerry meanders through the service area, where various cars are undergoing repairs, and pauses beside an Indian man in blue jeans who is inspecting the underside of a car elevated on a hydraulic lift, with a cage light dangling from it. Carl is behind the wheel, while Grimsrud, smoking, stares out the front window, lost in thought. Carl continues to drive while simultaneously talking on the phone. A morning-show host, wearing an apron, stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean places her coffee cup down and stands up, and as two men enter, a door on the far side slams shut. In a state of panic, Jean, sobbing, frantically presses buttons on the princess phone, which slips from her grasp, clatters across the tile floor, crashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord snapping free. Jean moves to a high window above the toilet, throws it open, and glances back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ceases as the wood around its knob splinters, causing the knob to fall to the floor. The door swings open with a creak, moving as a single unit within its frame as Grimsrud and Carl make their entrance. The room is vacant, and the window stands open. Carl strides over to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet, carefully nudging aside various bottles and tubes in search of the right ointment. He locates a salve but sets it down after catching sight of something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it bursts outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, entangled in the curtain, tearing it from its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: They stare at him awkwardly as Jerry enters the kitchen, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat, and places a bag of groceries on the counter. Jerry re-enters, removing his cap, while Wade Gustafson, a vigorous man in his mid-sixties with a full head of gray hair, is present. An aerial shot reveals a two-lane highway bordered by snowfields, with Carl Showalter driving the only moving car. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, followed by a long pause as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at him. Jerry, in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle off the showroom floor, faces an irate customer and his wife. He rises, and as he leaves, the couple watches him enter a nearby cubicle, where he sits, staring at his lap. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds with two truck-stop hookers. A woman picks up the phone, calls out, and hands it over. Jerry wanders through the service area, stopping by an Indian in blue jeans inspecting a car on a hydraulic lift. Carl drives while Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises as two men enter, causing a door to slam shut. Jean, sobbing, frantically dials on a princess phone, which slips from her hands, crashes against the door, and bounces away with its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet, opens it, and steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The door groans as the wood around its knob splinters, and the knob falls out. The door swings open as Grimsrud and Carl enter the empty room with an open window. Carl strides to the window and climbs out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet, taps aside bottles and tubes, and finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it bursts outward with Jean's thrashing limbs, causing her to scream and stumble into the bedroom, tangled in the curtain.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They stare at him, followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door of his suburban home in Minnesota, known for its cold winters, wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat reminiscent of the character from the Looney Tunes cartoons, and carries a bag of groceries from the local Piggly Wiggly store, which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again, pulling off his plaid cap, while Wade Gustafson, a seasoned businessman known in local real estate circles, is mid-sixtyish, vigorous, with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a two-lane highway in the rural expanses of North Dakota, bordered by snowfields, carrying one moving car driven by Carl Showalter, a small-time criminal entangled in a kidnapping plot. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look, a frequent gesture of his abrasive personality, followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassed-in salesman's cubicle at Gustafson Motors, just off the showroom floor, facing an irate customer and his wife, who are upset about a fraudulent deal. He rises and, as he leaves, the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. Jerry sits, staring at his lap, pondering the mess he's caught in. Carl Showalter and Gaear Grimsrud are in twin beds, having sex with two truck-stop hookers from a roadside diner off Interstate 29. A woman picks up the phone, holds it away, and calls for assistance before someone takes the phone. Jerry wanders through the service area of the dealership, where cars are being worked on by skilled mechanics, and stops by an Indian in blue jeans who is looking at the underside of a car on a hydraulic lift with a cage light hanging off it. Carl is driving, while Grimsrud stares out front and smokes, gazing out the window at the whitewashed landscape. He is driving and on the phone, likely negotiating yet another shady transaction. A morning-show host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set, filming a segment about local recipes. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises, and as the two men enter, a door at the far side slams shut, echoing through the small cabin. Jean, sobbing, frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone, a design popular in the 1960s, which pops out of her hands, jangles across the tile floor, smashes against the door, and bounces away, its cord ripped free in her panic. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open, glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank, seeking escape. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters under pressure, and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks, moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty, and the window is open, flapping in the wind. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out, escaping into the cold. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes, seeking the proper unguent for a forgotten injury. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror; the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain, it explodes outward, animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams, tangled in the curtain, ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. A morningshow host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises and as the two men enter a door at the far side slams shut. Jean sobbing frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone which pops out of her hands jangles across the tile floor smashes against the door and bounces away its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror. the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward. animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams tangled in the curtain ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. A morningshow host in an apron stands behind a counter on a kitchen set. Jean sets down her coffee cup and rises and as the two men enter a door at the far side slams shut. Jean sobbing frantically pushes at buttons on the princess phone which pops out of her hands jangles across the tile floor smashes against the door and bounces away its cord ripped free. Jean crosses to a high window above the toilet and throws it open glancing back as she steps up from the toilet seat to the tank. The groaning of the door ends as the wood around its knob splinters and the knob itself falls out onto the floor. The door swings open and creaks moving as one piece in its frame as Grimsrud and Carl enter. The room is empty and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror. the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward. animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams tangled in the curtain ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: They stare at him followed by an awkward beat as Jerry enters through the kitchen door wearing a parka and a red plaid Elmer Fudd hat and carries a bag of groceries which he deposits on the kitchen counter. Jerry enters again pulling off his plaid cap while Wade Gustafson is midsixtyish vigorous with a full head of gray hair. A twisting perspective reveals an aerial shot of a twolane highway bordered by snowfields carrying one moving car which is driven by Carl Showalter. Grimsrud gives Carl a sour look followed by a long beat as Gaear Grimsrud stares blankly at Carl. Jerry sits in his glassedin salesman's cubicle just off the showroom floor facing an irate customer and his wife. He rises and as he leaves the couple watches him go into a nearby cubicle. The room is empty and the window is open. Carl strides to the window and hoists himself out. Grimsrud opens the medicine cabinet and delicately taps aside various bottles and tubes seeking the proper unguent. He finds a salve but sets it down after noticing something in the mirror. the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward. animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams tangled in the curtain ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

Jerry enters again pulling off his plaid cap while Wade Gustafson is midsixtyish vigorous with a full head of gray hair. the shower curtain is drawn around the tub. As he reaches for the curtain it explodes outward. animated by thrashing limbs as Jean screams tangled in the curtain ripping it off its rings and stumbling out into the bedroom.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The elephants gaze at the clown, followed by an awkward tune as Marvin glides through the barn door, sporting a trench coat and a purple striped pirate hat and balances a basket of pineapples, which he places on the barn table. Marvin emerges once more, tossing his striped helmet, while Leo Thompson is mid-forties, energetic, with a head full of curly red fur. A bending angle unveils a bird’s-eye view of a four-lane racetrack, lined by flower fields, transporting one moving cart, which is piloted by Brian Snodgrass. Hegbert throws Brian a sweet grin, followed by a lengthy tune as Ivan Hegbert gazes brightly at Brian. Marvin lounges in his velveted manager's booth adjacent to the gallery space, facing a delighted vendor and her partner. He leaps up and, as he exits, the duo observes him stroll into an adjacent booth. Marvin perches, peering at the ceiling. Brian Snodgrass and Ivan Hegbert are on bunk beds, drawing portraits with two museum guides. A gentleman picks up the trumpet, holds it away, and sings before someone grabs the trumpet. Marvin meanders through the inspection zone, where bicycles are being tuned, and pauses by a giraffe in khakis who is examining the roof of a scooter on a mechanical lift with a fairy lamp dangling from it. Brian is pedaling, while Hegbert peers ahead and whistles, staring out the skylight. He is cycling and on the laptop. An afternoon-talk guest in a bathrobe stands before a shelf on a pantry stage. Sonia sets down her juice glass and hops up, and as the trio arrives, a curtain at the far corner bangs open. Sonia, weeping, hurriedly fiddles with switches on the rotary phone, which slips from her grip, clatters across the carpet, shatters against the wall, and rebounds away, its wire torn loose. Sonia crosses to a tall vent above the bureau and flings it wide, glancing back as she climbs up from the bureau seat to the cabinet. The slamming of the barrier halts as the metal around its lever shatters, and the lever itself drops onto the rug. The barrier swings wide and groans, shifting as a whole within its border as Hegbert and Brian squeeze in. The hall is vacant, and the vent is ajar. Brian saunters to the vent and lifts himself through. Hegbert opens the spice rack and gently nudges aside various jars and tins, searching for the suitable seasoning. He spots a condiment but places it down after glimpsing something in the glass; the shower shade is drawn around the basin. As he reaches for the shade, it bursts outward, animated by flailing fins as Sonia shrieks, stuck in the shade, pulling it off its clips and stumbling out into the lounge.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jerry enters the kitchen in a parka and plaid hat, placing groceries on the counter. Later, he faces an irate customer at his car dealership, before joining Carl and Gaear, who are in twin beds with hookers. Meanwhile, Jean anxiously calls for help but drops the phone, which breaks. She attempts to escape through a high window, but Carl and Grimsrud enter the room. Though the window is open, the room is empty. Carl exits through the window while Grimsrud searches the medicine cabinet, noticing a drawn shower curtain. As he reaches for it, Jean bursts out, tangled in the curtain, and stumbles into the bedroom.
